They hang a white clock with your father’s red griffin over your shoulders. “My Lady looks beautiful.” One of the maids says. You heave a sigh and rip your eyes from the window. “Thank you Bella.” You say softly. “Now come my lady. The King is waiting.” The other maid urges you out of the door.

Rheagal is decked out in royal armour, but Drogon and Viserion are not. Their bodies warm the air around the sept. Your father approaches. His red hair is turning white, but his green eyes still search your soul. You take his hands. His bad hand, with two fingers missing. But better a bad hand than greyscale. “I love you father.” You say. “I love you too.” He replies.

Your father leads you into the sept. It is packed. The whole court and half the realms nobility is present for the royal wedding. You squeeze your father’s hand. “You’ll do fine.” He says softly. “I hope you are are right.” You mumble. “The old gods and the new know I am.” Your father replies. He leads you to the altar.

He smiles at you and still looks like someone kicked his favorite pup. Not that said pup would get kicked. The albino direwolf lays at the King’s feet. summary: what's your favorite jon snow moment?
question: what's your favorite jon snow moment?
answer:
I have so many, this was almost impossible to choose. One of the top moments, however, is when he said goodbye to the people that mattered most to him in Winterfell. It’s a really big favorite of mine, especially on rereads. I teared up the last time I read him saying goodbye to Bran, standing up to Catelyn just so he could have a few minutes to say farewell to his brother.

“Shall I call the guards?”

“Call them,” Jon said, defiant. “You can’t stop me from seeing him.“ 

He crossed the room, keeping the bed between them, and looked down on Bran where he lay…This was not the Bran he remembered. The flesh had all gone from him. His skin stretched tight over bones like sticks. Under the blanket, his legs bent in ways that made Jon sick…

…"Bran,” he said, “I’m sorry I didn’t come before. I was afraid.” He could feel the tears rolling down his cheeks. Jon no longer cared. “Don’t die, Bran. Please. We’re all waiting for you to wake up. Me and Robb and the girls, everyone …”  

This moment just feels so hopeless. Jon’s emotions are expressed so well, and it really endeared me to him. After the first couple of Jon POV chapters, I was immediately hooked and knew I’d be a fan of his for a long time. 

(While this moment makes me cry, it’s nothing compared to when Jon’s joy when he finds out that Bran is alive and awake, when he asks Tyrion to help his brother in any way he can. Jon’s relationship with Arya, Robb, and Sansa is looked at a lot in meta and fic, but I think his relationship with Bran was equally as loving and beautiful.)

summary: Thrones stars turn out in droves for Belfast wrap party
title: Thrones stars turn out in droves for Belfast wrap party
excerpt: Social media hasn't disappointed with an inside peak
description:
There was a wrap party for HBO’s Game of Thrones in Belfast at Waterfront Hall on Saturday. It wasn’t really a public event though photos from it inevitably ended up on Twitter. Even newlywed Kit Harington, still with his Jon Snow hair, showed up for the occasion.

Presumably this means filming for Season 8 is complete; though there’s still an enormous amount of post-production to do before the final product will be ready.

title: Shadows 10/??
body:
(Hidden Truths excerpt)

“Never seen them act so familiar with a stranger either,” Jorah was saying though he shrugged and motioned for everyone to head into the living room. “Guess malamutes are friendlier than I thought.”

No one was sure of how to respond to that, but Gendry broke the silence with a loud whistle in appreciation at the set-up, and spent the next several minutes gushing about how clear the images were on screen, and just how much did it cost Jorah to buy this, and was it possible to get it on discount etc. etc. Jon, who might have automatically began heading to the kitchen to drop off the cooler, was rescued by Missandei who offered to do it. She insisted he sit down and relax, her quick warning glare reminding him of how he was supposed to act.

Taking note of the rearranged décor, and he wasn’t entirely sure he liked it as he was now so used to the way things were, Jon sat as far away from Dany’s wheelchair as he could manage. Not that it made much of a difference, for she was almost directly across him now, though facing the television. This gave him a good view of her profile, and for a long, helpless minute he studied every inch of that regal outline including how lovely her hair looked (those braids must have taken hours to get right), the silky sheen of that silver mane he would love to run his fingers through, the glint of amusement to bounce off those pretty violet eyes, the soft rosy hue of her cheeks almost matching the plump sweetness of her lips and –

“Chips and dip?” came the sudden question as a large bowl of the snack was thrust beneath his nose. He was ready to shake his head when he met Arya’s light scowl. Hardly moving her lips, she whispered to him beneath her breath.

“Keep staring like that, you idiot, and you’ll give up the whole game before it’s even started.”

Jon couldn’t shovel the salty snack into his mouth fast enough.

Continue on AO3

Thanks to the lovely @annagreengrass for the fab moodboard!

summary: Jon Snow as a Westerosian Horus
title: Jon Snow as a Westerosian Horus
body:
Whilst reseaching for one of my novels, heavily influenced by Egyptain mythology, I came across a reference to the Horus Myth and I was surprised I had never noticed it before.

I don’t know if it has been picked up on before but i’m just going to explain my thoughts anyway.

In the myth in question, Horus, known as Horus the Younger was the son of Isis and Osiris. When his father was murdered by his UNCLE Set, they fought an  EPIC MYTHICAL BATTLE against eachother and Horus was victorious. He then untied the TWO LANDS of Egypt, and during his defeat of Set, HE LOST AN EYE.

Now I can’t recall where i read it, someone else might, but I remember reading an interview where GRRM says he based the T*rgaryen Dynasty on the Pharaohs of Egypt and that their insistance to keep the bloodlines pure lead to the downfall. So it is plausable he came across these Myths during his writing.

The way I come to see it, whilst D*ny isn’t the one who killed Jon’s father, she is his AUNT, and if the Dark D*ny theory is correct, I don’t doubt there will be a battle of epic proportions, worthy of the SONG of the title. If he does defeat her, and he becomes his father’s Heir he could unit the two lands of Westeros, THE NORTH (King in the North) and THE SOUTH (The Iron Throne). 

And if the theory regarding Jon losing an eye in the battle for the dawn, or even against D*ny herself, comes to fruition, he would be fulfilling the Myth of Horus.

Just a thought!
